categories: Category:Articles with an excess of redlinks

nodes.text: Star Wars: Datapad, named after the in-universe datapad, is a mobile game found within the Play Disney Parks app that will allow guests of Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge to interact with attractions and features in the theme park area. Most features will only work when the user is within the park. It was first released as part of a May 24th, 2019 update to the Disneyland section of the app, days prior to the opening of that park's Galaxy's Edge area on May 31st.

Features of Datapad include "hacking" (to interact with door panels or droids), "scanning" (to inspect cargo), "translation" (to decode all the Aurebesh signs throughout the attraction), “tuning” (to listen into secret communications), and "Outpost Control" (a game in which visitors choose First Order or Resistance).
As users play and explore they will unlock a variety of outfits, equipment, star maps, schematics, droid data, transmissions, and titles.
